str2: In order that, so that. Probably from the same as the former part of heautou; in order that.

parse: Verb - Present Subjunctive Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: From peri and pateo; to tread all around, i.e. Walk at large; figuratively, to live, deport oneself, follow.
Becomingly, decorously, decently. Adverb from euschemon; decorously.
To, towards, with. A strengthened form of pro; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. Toward.
Without, outside. Adverb from ek; out(-side, of doors), literally or figuratively.

parse: Verb - Present Subjunctive Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: To have, hold, possess. Including an alternate form scheo skheh'-o; a primary verb; to hold.
From the base of chraomai or chre; employment, i.e. An affair; also occasion, demand, requirement or destitution.
